data.question: What is the name of the first breathing titanium metal-organic framework synthesized?
What unique cluster is COK-69 built up from?
What property of COK-69 was investigated using proton-coupled electron-transfer experiments?
Can up to one TiIV center per cluster in COK-69 be photoreduced to TiIII while preserving the structural integrity of the framework?
What is the band gap of COK-69 as determined by molecular modeling?
Is the synthesis of titanium-carboxylate MOFs challenging due to the high reactivity of alkoxide precursors?
What precursor was used to synthesize COK-69?
What is the formula for the evacuated COK-69 material?
Does COK-69 exhibit a breathing behavior?
What causes the breathing behavior of COK-69?
data.answer: The conformational flexibility of the cdc2¢ linker

data.question: What happens to the porosity of COK-69 upon evacuation?
data.answer: It becomes limited with a BET surface area of 29.1 m2 g¢1

data.question: Can polar solvents reopen the evacuated material of COK-69?
What is the effect of UV-A light irradiation on COK-69?
data.answer: It affords a blue solid, COK-69_R, indicating photoreduction

data.question: What species is indicated by the EPR spectrum of photoreduced COK-69?
Is the photoreduction of COK-69 reversible upon exposure to air?
How many TiIV centers per Ti3 cluster can be reduced in COK-69 according to PCET experiments?
data.answer: One third of all TiIV, that is, one TiIV center per Ti3 cluster

data.question: Does the reduction rate differ between COK-69cp and COK-69op?
What is the empirical formula proposed for COK-69_R?
What is the role of titanocene dichloride in the synthesis of COK-69?
data.answer: It acts as a hydrolytically more robust organometallic Ti precursor

data.question: Is the synthesis of COK-69 scalable using microwave irradiation?
